      • LOG

        public static java.lang.Integer LOG
        Define which log levels should be enabled.

        Default: E_ERROR|E_WARNING

      • PATH

        public static java.lang.String[] PATH
        This property can be used to extend the shells PATH variable. Just create a new String[] containing the paths that you need.

        The original locations will not be deleted, but your new once will have main priority. Just note that this needs to be set BEFORE you create the RootFW instance.

      • instance

        public static RootFW instance(java.lang.String aName,
              java.lang.Boolean aRoot,
              java.lang.Boolean aOwner)
        This is the same as using "RootFW(Boolean aRoot)", only this one will create a named instance. If an instance with the parsed name already exist, a clone will be provided instead using the same shell connection as the main instance. This will allow you to reuse connections across classes and methods without the need to manually parse them.

        Note: Clones are not allows to close a connection. So calling "close()" from a cloned instance will not close the shell connection. It will not be closed until "close()" is called from the main instance.

        Parameters:
        aName - The name of the instance
        aRoot - Whether to connect as root or as a regular user
        aOwner - Whether to return the owner instance (Instead of a copy)
        Returns:
        Returns a new or cloned instance of RootFW

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the shell connection.

        Note: that this will be ignored if called from a cloned instance. Only the main instance are allowed to close the shell connection.

      • connected

        public java.lang.Boolean connected()
        See connected(Boolean aForceReconnect)

      • connected

        public java.lang.Boolean connected(java.lang.Boolean aForceReconnect)
        Check to see if the instance has successfully established a connection to the shell. If you created the instance with root permissions, it will also check to make sure that the connection has these permissions.
        Parameters:
        aForceReconnect - Whether to force a reconnect if the connection is not established
        Returns:
        Whether or not a shell connection has been established

      • process

        public java.lang.Process process()
        Return the process belonging to the shell connection
        Returns:
        The shell process of the instance

      • lock

        public java.lang.Object lock()
        Return the lock object which can tell whether the connection is being used or not
        Returns:
        The lock object

       java.lang.String aMsg)

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String aTag,

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String aTag,
       java.lang.String aMsg,
       java.lang.Integer aLevel,
       java.lang.Throwable e)
        Generate logcat output. The method will only generate logcat output for levels enabled in com.spazedog.rootfw.RootFW.LOG
        Parameters:
        aTag - The name of the logger
        aMsg - The message to output
        aLevel - The level of the log (E_INFO, E_WARNING, E_ERROR, E_DEBUG)
        e - A Throwable error output
